results.title: The Chronicles of Narnia [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Marilyn Fox, Alex Kirby, Paul Stone and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Chronicles of Narnia”.
A breathtaking live action, made for television rendition of C. S. Lewis’ powerful fantasy for all ages using stunning special effects to recreate the most exciting and enchanting adventure of them all. “The Lion, the witch and the wardrobe”: four children, sent from London into the countryside during the dangerous period of WW2, discover the magical world of Narnia - where dwarves, nymphs and giants reside, fauns carry umbrellas, animals talk and horses fly. It is also the land of Aslan, the great lion who can warm the coldest heart and his arch-enemy, the White Witch. “Prince Caspian”: Troubled times have come to Narnia and the evil King Miraz and his scheming Queen Prunaprismia have brought misery and an army of destruction to the peaceful land. Young Prince Caspian, rightful heir to the throne vows to save his kingdom and calls upon the aid of Peter, Susan, Edmund and Lucy. “The Voyage of the dawn treader”: A new quest begins for Edmund and Lucy, who, with their horrible cousin Eustace, join King Caspian on a voyage to find seven missing Lords of Narnia. The Silver chair Old King Caspian’s only son and heir, Prince Rillian has disappeared. The great lion, Aslan, calls on Jill and Eustace, guiding them in their search for the lost prince. On their perilous quest, the children meet up with Puddleglum who travels with them to the land of giants. Their search leads them to face the Green Witch, the Queen of the Deep Realm whose spell they must break. Each edition also available separately on VHS [301499], [301990], [302722].

group_works.title: The Godless state
group_works.creator_credit: Michael Houlday, Michael Murphy and Granada Television International

results.title: The Godless state
results.creator_credit: Michael Houlday, Michael Murphy and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Christians”.
Traces the development of religious indifference and atheism from the French Revolution to the present. Focuses on the current state of religion in the Soviet Union, Poland, and Italy. However, makes the statement that with the New Testament there is no clear impression for readers about what Christianity stood for. The reader can glean from it any message that he/she wants…therefore Christianity has the ability to adapt.

results.title: Jamie, Ethan and Keir: 2-14 months
results.creator_credit: Robert Humble, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Child”.
The world at toddler’s eye level. For months a baby lies in his crib looking at all those things just beyond his reach. Then he learns to move about, to crawl, to stand and suddenly all those things are his to touch, to taste. This film observes a baby’s natural curiosity, his way of “getting into things” as part of the experience of learning and adapting. Differences in behaviour of the three babies are noted.

results.title: Westernport Bay: the ecosystem
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Changing Landscape”.
Graham Pizzey, photographer of wild birds runs a reserve where people can view the birds without affecting the natural environment. He stresses the importance of the need for environmental studies in the Westernport region before it is disturbed by industry.

results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Changing Landscape”.
Charles Nancarrow, Wildlife Management Officer, shos the variety of land usage on the Islands of Westernport bay and its effect on the wildlife.

results.title: Westernport Bay: the catchment
results.creator_credit: Harris Smart and Victorian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Changing Landscape”.
Grant Hazelgrove shows the many recreational and other activities in Westernport Bay and discusses the role of the Westernport Catchment Co-ordinating Group in controlling the use of resources which have an impact on the bay.
